natural solution: First, multiply the fractions to get $$\frac{18}{17}\cdot\frac{13}{24}\cdot\frac{68}{39}=\frac{18\cdot 13 \cdot 68}{17 \cdot 24 \cdot 39}.$$Before we start multiplying these numbers out, let's see if the numerator and denominator share any common factors.

18 and 24 have a common factor of 6, 13 and 39 have a common factor of 13, while 17 and 68 have a common factor of 17. $$\frac{18}{17}\cdot\frac{13}{24}\cdot\frac{68}{39}=\frac{\cancel{6}\cdot3}{\cancel{17}\cdot1}\cdot\frac{\cancel{13}\cdot1}{\cancel{6}\cdot4}\cdot\frac{\cancel{17}\cdot4}{\cancel{13}\cdot3}.$$After this first round of simplification, we notice that we can cancel 4 and 3 from the resulting fraction, giving $$\frac{\cancel{3}}{\cancel{1}}\cdot\frac{\cancel{1}}{\cancel{4}}\cdot\frac{\cancel{4}}{\cancel{3}}=\boxed{1}.$$
